data.title: Crytek Considering Natal
data.meta_description: Crytek, makers of the gorgeous PC title Crysis, are interested in developing games that use Natal. Speaking to Develop-Online, Crytek UK's Managing Director Karl Hilton said, "The Natal project sounds fascinating." He added, "It's not something that Crytek is dealing with yet, but certainly something that we've all been interested in working with. Just making games higher and higher resolution is never going to be the future, there needs to be other routes too."
data.text:
Crytek, makers of the gorgeous PC title Crysis, are interested in developing games that use Natal. Speaking to Develop-Online, Crytek UK's Managing Director Karl Hilton said, "The Natal project sounds fascinating." He added, "It's not something that Crytek is dealing with yet, but certainly something that we've all been interested in working with. Just making games higher and higher resolution is never going to be the future, there needs to be other routes too."

Don't worry, Crytek isn't interested in making a carnival game or equally dumb mini-game collection. "Those types of games are not something we're going to be fixated on," Hilton told Develop-Online, "but we always are interested in new control inputs. I think people would appreciate the type of games Crytek is known for if there was more than button-pressing to them."

Microsoft's Project Natal does not yet have a release date, but smart money puts it at fall 2010.
